Bangladesh.seal: Official Seal of the Government of Bangladesh

historical_background.ancient_bengal: Known as Gangaridai, a bastion of pre-Islamic kingdoms.
historical_background.muslim_conquests: After 1204, led to the sultanate and Mughal periods.
historical_background.bengal_sultanate: An independent Bengal Sultanate was established.
historical_background.mughal_bengal: Wealthy Mughal Bengal, important in regional affairs, trade, and diplomacy.

british_era.bengal_presidency: Bengal's administrative jurisdiction reached its greatest extent.
british_era.eastern_bengal_and_assam: Creation in 1905 set a precedent for Bangladesh's emergence.

historical_background.partition_of_bengal: Bengal was divided during the Partition of India in 1947.
historical_background.liberation_war: In 1971, led to the independence of Bangladesh.

current_status.secular_state: First constitutionally secular state in South Asia in 1972.
current_status.supreme_court_reaffirmation: In 2010, the Supreme Court reaffirmed secular principles.

international_role.middle_power: A middle power in the Indo-Pacific.
international_role.language_significance: Home to the sixth-most spoken language in the world.
international_role.muslim_population: Third-largest Muslim-majority population in the world.
international_role.un_peacekeeping: Largest contributor of personnel to UN peacekeeping operations.

iso_3166_code.political_structure: Unitary parliamentary republic based on the Westminster system.

demographics.bengali_population: Bengalis make up 99% of the total population.

administrative_divisions.largest_mangrove_forest: Hosts the world's largest mangrove forest.

iso_3166_code.refugee_population: Hosts one of the largest refugee populations due to the Rohingya genocide.
iso_3166_code.leadership_in_climate_vulnerable_forum: Bangladesh has been a leader within the Climate Vulnerable Forum.
international_affiliations: Member of the Organization of Islamic Cooperation
Member of the Commonwealth of Nations
